net.viktorc.detroid.util

Class LossyHashTable<T extends LossyHashTable.Entry<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.viktorc.detroid.util.LossyHashTable<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The hash table entry type that implements the Entry interface.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>

    public class LossyHashTable<T extends LossyHashTable.Entry<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<T>
    A generic hash table for statistical or turn-based game AI applications with massive storage requirements where losslessness is inefficient. It utilizes a lossy version of cuckoo hashing with constant time look-up and constant time insertion that, instead of pushing out and relocating entries (and rehashing all of them when a cycle is entered) until all hash collisions are resolved, just does the equivalent of one and a half iterations of the standard cuckoo insertion loop in case of a hash conflict. Entries of the hash table implement Entry and thus implement the Comparable and Hashable interfaces. The storage scheme is based on asymmetric hashing with two hash tables with different sizes in decreasing order, thus it does not really have two unique hash functions. All it ever does is take the absolute value of the hash keys of the entries and derive mod [respective table's size]; it applies no randomization whatsoever either. Due to the uneven table sizes, look up is biased towards the first table.
    Author:
    Viktor

    • Constructor Detail

      • LossyHashTable

        public LossyHashTable(int capacity)
        Initializes a hash table with a capacity of the closest lesser than or equal prime number to the specified maximum capacity. The capacity has to be at least 1024 (2^10) and at most 1073741824 (2^30).
        Parameters:
        capacity - Maximum hash table capacity.

            throws java.lang.NullPointerException

        public T get(long key)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The entry mapped to the specified key.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(long key)
        Removes the entry identified by the input parameter long integer 'key' from the hash table and returns true if it is in the hash table; returns false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        key - The 64 bit hash key.
        Returns:
        Whether there was an entry mapped to the specified key.
